posts.name: Thomas McDonald
posts.cooked:
We are using the most recent version of robotpy, 2025.0.0b2, and all of its requirements. In sim, everything works great. However, after doing a robotpy sync, I tried to do a deploy. Then, I got the error saying: ERROR: No matching distribution found for numpy and ERROR: Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement numpy(from versions: none)

Any help is greatly appreciated!

posts.name: Thomas McDonald
posts.cooked:
I mean sure, but it runs in fine in sim. It really seems to be a problem with packages.

testing-pathplanner-beta-version

Contribute to Ultime5528/FRC2024 development by creating an account on GitHub.

posts.name: Dustin Spicuzza
posts.cooked:
Your pyproject.toml looks right. Try running robotpy sync again and pasting the output here?

Another thing to try – it should put the files in ~/wpilib/2025/robotpy/pip_cache/ … so see if there’s a numpy wheel there. You might try just deleting all the files there, then run robotpy sync again and see if it does it correctly. Might be a bug in the installer sync code.

posts.name: Thomas McDonald
posts.cooked:
I deleted the pip_cache and reran robotpy sync . I then proceded to do the exact same thing. My pip_cache does indeed have a wheel for numpy. This is my deploy:

posts.name: Dustin Spicuzza
posts.cooked: oh that’s funny. I think you have the 2024 robotpy-installer installed, you need the beta version. We’ll need to fix it so that isn’t possible in the future.

posts.name: Dustin Spicuzza
posts.cooked: This should be fixed in robotpy-installer 2024.2.4 and 2025.0.0b3
